intro: Nargedia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited nargis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
